title: UP Teen Dies By Suicide After Losing Rs 14 lakh In Online Game
content: A 13-year-old boy in the Mohanlalganj area of Lucknow hanged himself after losing the entire Rs 14 lakh of his father's bank account in an online game, police said on Tuesday.

title: No Alcohol Found In BMW Car Crash Accused's Blood Sample
content: The blood sample report of Gaganpreet Kaur, the main accused in the Delhi BMW crash, has been reported to be negative, which means she wasn't driving under the influence of alcohol.

title: Houses, IT Park Submerged As Heavy Rain Triggers Flash Floods In Dehradun

content: Arpana from Nepal reached India six months ago and has been waiting for a donor heart for the past four months, having registered in the organ transplant waiting list

content: A CBI Special Court convicts Administrative Officer (Accounts) of Oriental Insurance Co. Ltd., Divisional Office, T. Pradeep of misappropriation

title: ICC rejects PCB's demand to remove match referee; will they pull out?
content: The ICC rejected PCB's request to replace match referee Andy Pycroft during the Asia Cup after Pakistan alleged he instructed their captain to avoid handshakes with India's captain. The ICC clarified that ACC officials informed Pycroft about the no-handshake policy.

title: Roads blocked, vehicles swept away: Cloudburst in Himachal, Uttarakhand; rains trigger floods, landslides
content: Heavy rain, cloudbursts, and landslides have caused widespread destruction in Himachal Pradesh and Uttarakhand. In Himachal Pradesh, three people died in Mandi district due to a landslide. Uttarakhand was hit by a cloudburst in Dehradun, damaging properties and infrastructure. Rescue operations are underway, and authorities are providing assistance to those affected, with the Chief Ministers monitoring the situation.

title: BMW crash: FIR contradicts DCP's statement, claims counsel
content: In the Delhi BMW accident case near Dhaula Kuan, the accused's lawyer, Vikas Pahwa, claims the FIR contradicts the DCP's statement. Gaganpreet Kaur, the driver, is in judicial custody after the accident resulted in one death and one injury.

title: Raid on Assam civil servant tied to ‚Äòillegal transfer of Hindus‚Äô land‚Äô
content: Assam bureaucrat Nupur Bora, a 2019-batch ACS officer, has been arrested for alleged corruption involving illegal land transfers in Barpeta, where the government is targeting suspected Bangladeshi settlers. Raids on her properties revealed nearly ‚Çπ1 crore in cash and valuable jewelry. CM Sarma stated that Bora was under investigation for transferring land to a specific community and hoarding disproportionate assets.

title: Apple iOS 26 released: 26 features of Apple‚Äôs biggest software update of 2025
content: Apple's iOS 26 update introduces a revolutionary Liquid Glass design, transforming the iPhone interface with translucent elements. This update brings futuristic features like real-time language translation in calls and enhanced visual intelligence. Users can also enjoy customizable app icons, improved messaging features, and a centralized gaming hub, all while maintaining the familiar iOS experience.

title: Charlie Kirk assassination: Leftist ideology the motive? 10 key points about Tyler Robinson
content: Tyler Robinson is accused of assassinating conservative activist Charlie Kirk in Utah. Robinson allegedly confessed, citing irreconcilable hatred, and left a chilling note. Investigators are exploring his radicalized leftist ideology, online activity, and potential accomplices. The case has ignited national mourning, political repercussions, and security concerns, with prosecutors seeking the death penalty.

title: ITR filing: Why was due date extended by a day? What we know
content: Amid a record surge in Income Tax Return (ITR) filings, the government extended the deadline for Assessment Year 2025-26 by a day, pushing it to September 16, 2025, as taxpayers reported portal access issues. Over 7.3 crore returns were filed by the original deadline.

title: Google‚Äôs Nano Banana AI: Saree edits take over Insta; 5 mistakes to avoid
content: The internet is abuzz with the Google Gemini Nano Banana AI saree trend, enabling users to transform selfies into 90s Bollywood-style portraits. These viral edits feature chiffon sarees, grainy textures, and golden-hour lighting, achieved through precise AI prompts.

title: Asia Cup: Who is Pycroft, the match referee that PCB wanted to remove
content: Following India's victory over Pakistan in the Asia Cup, a controversy arose when the Indian team refused to shake hands, dedicating their win to armed forces after a terror attack. The PCB filed a complaint with the ICC, alleging the match referee Andy Pycroft instructed captains against shaking hands.

title: Delhi BMW crash: Watch for dad, earrings for mom ‚Äî birthday gifts that weren't to be
content: Navjot Singh, a deputy secretary in the finance ministry, tragically died in an accident near Dhaula Kuan. His wife, Sandeep Kaur, was critically injured. The incident occurred just before their son, Navnoor Singh's birthday. Navjot Singh had a distinguished career, representing India at international forums. He was remembered as a dedicated family man and a passionate individual with diverse interests.

title: 'Gaza is burning': Video shows building razed to rubble as Israel begins major offensive
content: Following US Secretary of State Marco Rubio's pledge of unwavering support, Israel intensified airstrikes on Gaza City, resulting in widespread destruction and casualties. Defense Minister Israel Katz declared "Gaza is burning" as the military prepares for a new offensive, urging civilians to evacuate.

title: Google Gemini Nano Banana: Experts warn about AI tool's safety risk
content: Google's Gemini Nano Banana AI tool has sparked viral trends like 3D figurines and Bollywood-style saree transformations. While Google implements watermarks for AI-generated content, experts warn about potential privacy and security risks, including data misuse and scams. Authorities advise caution when sharing personal information and using unofficial apps.

title: Thrashing, protest, threats: How India vs Pak has played out - a blow-by-blow account
content: India dominated Pakistan in the Asia Cup clash on Sunday, securing a 7-wicket victory. Suryakumar Yadav dedicated the win to the armed forces and Pahalgam terror attack victims. Post-match, India's team skipped the customary handshake, and Pakistan's coach expressed disappointment.

title: Who is Charlie Kirk's ‚Äòsecret sister‚Äô? Meet 29-year-old with ‚Äòsurprising‚Äô political views
content: Following the tragic death of Charlie Kirk, attention has turned to his family, revealing his younger sister, Mary Kirk. Despite growing up in the same moderate household, Mary holds contrasting political beliefs, leaning towards progressive causes. While Charlie championed conservative ideals, Mary supports Bernie Sanders, slavery education, and cultural funding, showcasing a surprising divergence within the family.

title: Dehradun cloudburst: Scary visuals of flash floods emerge
content: A cloudburst in Dehradun triggered flash floods, causing significant damage and disrupting traffic. A bridge collapsed on the Dehradun-Haridwar highway, and the Sahastradhara river overflowed, damaging shops. The Tamsa River flooded the Tapkeshwar Mahadev temple premises, prompting rescue operations by SDRF and police. Authorities are on high alert, monitoring the situation.

title: Sandalwood scam: Kannada actor Upendra, wife targeted; friends cheated via WhatsApp
content: Sandalwood stars Upendra Rao and Priyanka Upendra fell victim to a sophisticated digital scam after their phones were hacked by fraudsters impersonating a courier service. The scammers then sent messages to the couple's contacts requesting urgent financial assistance, leading some, including their son, to transfer money.

title: India-US trade deal: First in-person talks since Trump imposed 50% tariffs; what to expect
content: India and the US resumed trade talks, the first since the US imposed tariffs on New Delhi over Russian oil purchases. The meeting aims to establish a roadmap for addressing trade matters, focusing on issues like agricultural import duties and commodity procurement.

title: Charlie Kirk killing: Did Robinson confess? Kash Patel cites DNA link & a threatening text
content: FBI Director Kash Patel revealed a crucial development in the Charlie Kirk assassination case, stating that investigators recovered a text thread where Tyler Robinson expressed his intent to kill Kirk out of "hatred." Forensic evidence confirms Robinson's DNA on the firearm and a screwdriver. Robinson also apparently confessed to the crime on Discord before his arrest.

title: 'Understandable to tariff India but...': Zelenskyy urges US action on Russia; makes big Putin claim
content: Volodymyr Zelenskyy suggested that Washington consider tariffs on nations like India for buying Russian oil, but cautioned against delaying action against Vladimir Putin, asserting that delays benefit Moscow. He criticized Putin's perceived gains from a recent summit with Donald Trump, emphasizing that Putin is actively trying to manipulate his way out of global isolation.

title: Himachal Pradesh rain fury: Flood wreaks havoc in Dharampur; 3 dead in landslides
content: Heavy rainfall in Himachal Pradesh's Mandi district triggered severe destruction, particularly in Dharampur town, where flooding swept away vehicles and submerged the bus stand. A landslide in Nihri resulted in three deaths, with rescue operations ongoing. The monsoon's impact has been devastating, causing numerous fatalities, substantial economic losses, and widespread damage to infrastructure, housing, and agriculture across the state.

title: Sunjay Kapur's wife makes 1st public appearance amid his Rs 30K cr inheritance row
content: Priya Sachdev Kapur, amidst a legal battle over her late husband Sunjay Kapur's estate, has stepped into his business legacy. Attending the ACMA Annual Convention in Delhi, she was also inducted into ACMA‚Äôs Executive Committee for 2025-26. Sunjay's children, Samaira and Kiaan, are contesting his will, alleging Priya altered it to exclude them from their inheritance.

title: Asia Cup: India qualify for Super 4s; what happens if Pakistan pull out?
content: Pakistan Cricket Board is in a standoff with the International Cricket Council. This follows a handshake controversy with the Indian team. PCB threatens to boycott their Asia Cup match against UAE. They demand the removal of match referee Andy Pycroft. If Pakistan withdraws, they will be eliminated. India has already qualified for the Super 4s.

title: 'Degenerate newspaper': Trump files $15bn lawsuit against NYT; calls it 'radical left' mouthpiece
content: Donald Trump has initiated a $15 billion defamation lawsuit against The New York Times, accusing the paper of being a Democratic mouthpiece engaged in a long-term smear campaign. Trump claims their endorsement of Kamala Harris was an illegal campaign contribution.

title: Life on Mars: Nasa rover discovers strongest sign of life on Mars; all you need to know
content: NASA's Perseverance rover has detected compelling evidence of potential past life on Mars within Jezero Crater. The rover's analysis of a mudstone core revealed minerals and textures indicative of microbial activity, including vivianite and greigite. While not definitive proof, these findings represent a significant step in the search for life beyond Earth, pending further analysis of returned samples.

title: UK PM vs Musk: Starmer slams Tesla CEO's 'fight or die' remark; calls him 'hostile'
content: Keir Starmer's office has strongly condemned Elon Musk for his "dangerous and inflammatory language" at a far-right protest in London, attended by approximately 150,000 people. Musk called for the dissolution of Parliament and warned of impending violence. Home Secretary Shabana Mahmood also criticized Musk, labeling him a "hostile billionaire" for undermining British democracy, following clashes that injured 26 police officers.

title: Harvard study reveals dangers of late breakfast: Here's what you need to know
content: A recent study reveals that delaying breakfast is associated with a higher risk of mortality and various health issues like fatigue and depression. Researchers found that for each hour breakfast was delayed, the risk of death increased by 8-11%. Prioritizing earlier, consistent mealtimes and a nutritious breakfast is crucial for overall well-being and longevity, especially as we age.

title: Car driven by cop mows down 2 schoolkids in Haryana's Palwal
content: In Palwal's Hathin, a tragic incident occurred on Kot-Uttawar road where a police constable's car struck three children returning from school, resulting in the deaths of Ayaan (13) and Ahsaan (9). Arjaan (7) sustained severe injuries and is receiving advanced treatment.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 opens near 25,100; BSE Sensex up around 70 points
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, opened in green on Tuesday. While Nifty50 was near 25,100, BSE Sensex was up over 70 points.

title: ‚ÄòExpect Europeans to do their share now‚Äô: US holds back on China tariffs
content: US treasury secretary Scott Bessent stated that the Trump administration will hold off on new tariffs on Chinese goods related to Russian oil purchases, pending substantial tariff actions from European countries. Bessent emphasised the need for Europe to increase pressure on Moscow's oil revenues, suggesting significant tariffs on buyers of Russian oil to effectively cut off Moscow's income source.

title: Fire & screams: Truck ploughs through traffic in Indore
content: A speeding truck in Indore tragically killed at least two people and injured several others near the Bada Ganpati temple. The uncontrolled vehicle struck pedestrians and vehicles before catching fire. Lakshmikant Soni, a Medicaps University professor, was among the deceased.

title: After handshake drama, Team India back to business in Dubai
content: Amidst controversy and PCB threats, India refocuses on cricket, securing their spot in the Asia Cup 2025 Super 4s after UAE's victory over Oman. The upcoming UAE-Pakistan match becomes a virtual knockout, crucial for Pakistan after their defeat to India.

title: Jayden Daniels injury update: Commanders' QB diagnosed with knee sprain
content: Washington Commanders' quarterback Jayden Daniels suffered a knee sprain during their Week 2 loss against the Green Bay Packers, casting doubt on his availability for the upcoming Week 3 game against the Las Vegas Raiders. While the MRI revealed no severe ligament damage, Daniels' participation hinges on his ability to demonstrate pain-free movement and agility in practice.

title: Top shares to buy: Stock market recommendations for today - check list
content: Stock market recommendations: Mirae Asset Sharekhan's Somil Mehta recommends buying Prestige, citing a breakout from a triangle pattern and positive momentum indicators, with a target of Rs 1720. GMR Airport is also a buy, according to Mehta, as it has broken out of a bullish consolidation pattern and is expected to reach Rs 97, supported by its 20-day moving average.

title: Ganguly makes honest confession: 'I stopped watching India vs Pak after just 15 overs'
content: Sourav Ganguly dismissed the India-Pakistan Asia Cup clash as one-sided, preferring to watch the Manchester derby. He cited a decline in Pakistan's team quality, stating the match no longer holds the competitive edge it once did. Ganguly also addressed the handshake controversy, emphasizing the need to end terrorism globally while deflecting questions about the players' actions to Suryakumar Yadav.

title: Delhi‚Äôs sex ratio dips to 920, falling for 4th year
content: Delhi's sex ratio at birth has declined for the fourth consecutive year, reaching 920 females per 1,000 males in 2024, raising concerns about illegal prenatal sex determination. The city also experienced a decrease in registered births alongside an increase in deaths.

title: Charlie Kirk‚Äôs influence: How Trump ally's views are changing NFL fan culture & game-day atmosphere
content: In 2025, the NFL navigates a cultural shift as conservative commentator Charlie Kirk's messages resonate with specific fan groups, emphasizing patriotism and tradition. This influence sparks debates among fans, altering the game-day experience with visible displays of support and contrasting views on political neutrality in sports. The NFL now reflects America's broader cultural divisions.

title: Nasa warning: 2025 FA22 asteroid nears Earth; bigger than Qutub Minar
content: Asteroid 2025 FA22, significantly larger than Delhi's Qutub Minar, will make a close approach to Earth on September 18, 2025. While NASA confirms it poses no collision threat, its size and proximity offer a valuable opportunity for scientific study. Traveling at approximately 24,127 miles per hour, this flyby allows researchers to refine orbital models and improve planetary defense strategies.

title: NBA Trade Rumors: Warriors eye $239.9M Grizzlies superstar; Kuminga contract troubles
content: The Golden State Warriors are reportedly considering a significant trade with the Memphis Grizzlies, offering young talent and draft picks for Jaren Jackson Jr. This move aims to bolster the Warriors' championship aspirations during Stephen Curry's prime. Memphis, in turn, would gain assets to rebuild around Ja Morant, gaining financial flexibility for the future.

title: Why Brentford's goal vs. Chelsea wasn't ruled out for offside; Maddison's VAR rage
content: Steve Nicol defends Mohamed Salah from criticisms of his overall play . the video assistant referee causes controversy every week in the premier league . we take a look at the major incidents in terms of VAR protocol and the Laws of the Game .

title: NFL Week 3 betting: Odds, lines and totals for every game
content: the Miami Dolphins host the Buffalo Bills on "Thursday Night Football" on tuesday . a matchup of undefeated teams will feature the New York Giants and the Kansas City Chiefs . the team is the biggest favorite on the week 3 slate .

title: From reassurance to accountability, who said what in Week 2?
content: Philadelphia Eagles vs. Kansas City Chiefs Game Highlights (1:00) NFL Week 2 saw plenty of close endings and wild moments that produced memorable quips. Along with a rematch of Super Bowl LIX between the  Philadelphia Eagles  and  Kansas City Chiefs , the  Detroit Lions  faced one of their former coaches in Chicago, the  Dallas Cowboys  picked up their first win and the  Miami Dolphins  continued to struggle. But following each respective matchup, players and coaches were open and vocal in their reactions. Can you correctly guess who said what? See how locked in you were during Week 2 below:

title: Virginia Tech fires Brent Pry: Top candidates, transfers and recruits to watch
content: the Virginia Tech Hokies fired coach Brent Pry after a 0-3 start to the season . Pry was supposed to represent a return to the Frank Beamer glory years in blacksburg . but a bowl game in 2023 and a faceplant to start this season closed the curtain for Pry .

title: WNBA playoff schedule: Every game in the first round, starting Sunday
content: the WNBA playoffs are finally here . the first round is a 1-1-1 format, with the higher seed hosting Game 1 and Game 3 . if necessary, the finals will expand to a best-of-seven series (2-2-1-1-1) format .

title: Top players discuss playoff format, cheat meals, hype-up music
content: the NHL is close to being back in action for the 2025-26 season . a new collective bargaining agreement has been signed between the league and the players . "cheat meals," pregame pump-up tunes and weird equipment quirks are among the favorites .

title: Fighters' grades: Did Crawford or Inoue have the better weekend?
content: three of ESPN's top 10 pound-for-pound fighters were in action this weekend . no. 3 Terence Crawford beat canelo alvarez at Allegiant Stadium in Las Vegas . Naoya Inoue put his undisputed junior featherweight titles on the line against murodjon Akhmadaliev .

title: NWSL: Jaedyn Shaw has supercharged Gotham FC
content: our writers studied the action from across Matchday 20 to come up with this week's order of all 14 teams in the league . the first team to hit the 50-point mark in 2025, the Kansas City Current climbed to that total on the back of a scoreless draw with the Washington Spirit .

content: manash Pratim Gohain is a seasoned journalist with over two decades at the Times of India . he has covered the national education policy (NEP) 2020, accreditation reforms, and skilling initiatives . his political reportage adds depth to his writing, bridging policy with public impact .

title: Baker Mayfield leads late drive as Buccaneers stun Texans in Houston
content: the Buccaneers beat the Texans 20-19 on "Monday Night Football" Baker Mayfield scored a game-winning touchdown drive with two minutes to go . he was flushed from the pocket and could not connect with rookie wideout Emeka Egbuka .
